summary: This document is an email chain from August 14-15, 2019, between individuals at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY). The subject is media monitoring related to Jeffrey Epstein, specifically an interview or article titled 'Jeffrey Epstein's on His Old Boss.' The participants discuss the quality of the piece and options for setting up more robust media alerts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the media article/interview being discussed by the prosecutors. The email chain is about monitoring coverage related to him.

events.title: Discussion of Epstein media coverage
events.description: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York exchange emails about an interview/article concerning Jeffrey Epstein and his 'Old Boss.' They critique the piece and discuss setting up more sophisticated media alerts.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively monitoring media coverage about Jeffrey Epstein in August 2019.
The subject of discussion was an interview or article titled 'Jeffrey Epstein's on His Old Boss,' which the prosecutors found 'absurd' and 'unprofessional.'
The prosecutors discussed using tools like Google Alerts or a more robust service called 'Critical Mention' for Boolean searches and faster updates.
The email chain shows internal coordination among prosecutors regarding public information about the Epstein case.
